CatDescriptText: A sign in window of the cleaners reads: "..Labor dispute...work in this shop done by owners only."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 15, 1951, pg. 2, reads: "Flayed by Union - The Frankstown Avenue cleaning establishment of Gus Freeman is being picketed by the Cleaners and Dyers Union because, the union charges, Mr. Freeman is not sending his work to a union shop. The union's position is explained in a letter (Post Office), published in this issue of the Courier."
TitMainTitle: Man protesting non-union labor in front of Freeman Cleaners, between Ruth's Restaurant and Loar's Barber Shop, 7353 Frankstown Avenue, Homewood
